title: Next Month's Painting
summary:
Teaching this one next month...there’ll be a few new techniques in it for some of my students..a black canvas and the round brush for foliage.
    This is a much easier one than this month’s seascape which they all managed beautifully and with much laughter! I love it towards the end of class when I see the paintings coming together. Sometimes I do a mad dash to a student’s easel to stop them from adding a single thing more...even if it means taking away their brushes.
    It’s always a hilarious moment. 😂
    Looking forward to seeing what they come up with.
    There is 1 available spot in the first class, and 3 in the second.
    💛🧡❤️💚🤎
    Golden Sunset
    Series 10 Episode 8
author: Maaret Webb

title: Still Life Class?
summary:
Anyone interested in a regular still life monthly class with me? The class would be held in Brisbane..at my Woolloongabba studio. I’ve had a few queries so I’m putting out feelers. We would be painting from life..not photos..and I would teach a tonal impressionist method that is very painterly but also user friendly for people who don’t draw...because no drawing is involved. 😂
    'Read More' for some more paintings.
author: Maaret Webb

title: Brisbane Classes Available for Booking
summary: Our Bob Ross painting classes are available for booking again from August through November in Brisbane. Never painted before? No problem. Bring some friends and have some fun learning to paint in Bob's original method. Everyone can do it. Head over to arthoughts.com to reserve a spot.
author: Maaret Webb

summary: How I paint my Daily Bobs when I travel and get them home without smudges...easy to stack the wet paintings on top of each other and put a clean one on top. 😁
author: Maaret Webb

title: Series 12 episode 4
summary:
Used the corner of the two inch and one inch brush for all the foliage in this one. Nice trick Bob..love those big brushes..so versatile.
    Also used Archival’s alkyd medium to thin the paint for highlights and branches..it’s fantastic...a safe and hassle-free allrounder that I’m substituting from now on for Bob’s liquid clear and thinners..ditching those horrors forever.
    And it’s made in Australia! 😊❤️
    Series 12 episode 4
    10”x12”
    Oil on canvas
author: Maaret Webb

title: Series 12 Episode 3
summary:
Enjoyed painting the mountains in this one..the little changes, like throwing the light from the left, the grassy areas at the base. I was a bit impatient following Bob in the video, so after painting the highlights on the mountains I finished it off using the image in the instruction manual. Could also be fun to first watch the video, then paint it from memory!
    Series 12 Episode 3
    10”x12”
    Oil on canvas
author: Maaret Webb

title: Yesterday’s class gems...
summary:
Yesterday’s class gems blew my mind how well the paintings turned out.
    I’ve put each of their paintings below..have a peek..
content: absolutely amazing! Sure do enjoy this gig, especially on days like this. These girls get what Bob is about, are loads of fun to be around and a dream to teach. ❤️❤️❤️
author: Maaret Webb

title: Second Trial Run
summary: Second trial run...easier to teach now I think. Will be an interesting class tomorrow, very talented fun girls who get what Bob is about..we’ll make up stories about the barn..today it became a barn conversion/summer getaway for me...in Finland...the sauna is tucked away behind the trees, right on the water. Hubby and I have gone berry picking..we found a wild strawberry patch. 🍓 🍓 🍓
author: Maaret Webb

title: Trial Painting for Upcoming Class
summary: Trial run for my next class...have to dig into my bag of tricks for this one, to make it manageable for my students. There are so many layers of paint in the lower half..ends up too gluggy, for me anyway. Going to try something different before Saturday..apply liquid white only to the top half of the canvas..the sky and water areas..then use straight dark paint on the bottom half, on dry canvas, before adding the highlights and other features. I’ll still be painting wet in wet, but hopefully not mud into mud. 😂
author: Maaret Webb

title: Classes Still Running For the Time Being
summary:
I’ve limited the numbers for GOld Coast classes to no more than 3...Brissie studio still fine for the maximum number of 9..more than enough space to keep a safe distance. I’ll keep teaching for as long as I can, not cancelling classes unless necessary.
    I am looking forward to starting my daily Bob’s again..life sure has gotten in the way..for a few months now. Happy painting friends and let’s stay connected. ❤️❤️❤️
author: Maaret Webb

title: Emerald Waters
summary:
Today’s class was Emerald Waters..4 different interpretations..all absolutely lovely. ❤️
    Next week I start painting my daily Bobs again. ❤️😁👍🎨🌟❤️
author: Maaret Webb

title: Event: Mo's Desert Clubhouse
summary: Another great night at Mo’s desert clubhouse.
content: Another great night at Mo’s desert clubhouse. Painting along to Bob’s episode “Evergreens at Sunset” projected onto a massive wall sized screen, in real time, 27 minutes, as part of the Bob Ross Challenge that is taking the world by storm..even reaching all the way down here! Enjoyed this night even more than the last one, maybe maybe because I didn’t do my talk and demonstration on stage, but down near the bar, where everybody else was hanging out. MOs makes the BEST sangria..and it’s on tap. 😁 🥴 .
author: Maaret Webb

title: Event: Bob Ross Challenge
summary: Hey, to anyone in the Gold Coast area on Thursday March 12th, come join me at Mo’s Desert Clubhouse in Burleigh Heads for the next Bob Ross challenge...
content: Hey, to anyone in the Gold Coast area on Thursday March 12th, come join me at Mo’s Desert Clubhouse in Burleigh Heads for the next Bob Ross challenge...it’s a lot of fun painting along with Bob to one of his tv episodes in real time...see if you can keep up with the boss. Drinks and nibblies available. Tickets from mosdesertclubhouse.com I’ll be there from 6:30pm onwards.
author: Maaret Webb

title: Mountain Splendour
summary: Teaching this at my next class..Mountain Splendour. I’ve learnt to appreciate Indian Yellow with this one..works beautifully in Autumn/Fall paintings.
content:
Teaching this at my next class..Mountain Splendour. I’ve learnt to appreciate Indian Yellow with this one..works beautifully in Autumn/Fall paintings. Bob’s approach to mountains here is rather tricky though, so I’ve simplified it for my students.

He spent a long time on the mountains, almost two thirds of the episode, and seems rushed towards the end with not enough time left to sign his name. But once again he pulls it off with a gorgeous end result. Quite incredible if you really think about it...Bob never once went over the time limit and every episode we see was unedited. Real deal, no smoke and mirrors.
author: Maaret Webb

title: Group Photos
summary: Bob Ross workshop group photos
author: Maaret Webb

title: Series 11
summary: Series 11...so far I’m not a fan. Bob experiments more in this series with liquid clear, which I find tricky and unpredictable.
content:
Series 11...so far I’m not a fan. Bob experiments more in this series with liquid clear, which I find tricky and unpredictable. This week I’m back into painting these smaller ones...been far too distracted for a few weeks now.

Decided to find one thing I like about this one and ignore what bugs me..I like the use of mostly blue in the background, and how it connects seamlessly with the blue of the water. Clever Bob..nice move.
author: Maaret Webb

title: Lazy River Practice
content: Practice pieces for class..did 4 in total. I’ m teaching it because some students want to paint scenes they can relate to here in Australia and this one comes close I’ ve been told, even without gum trees.They'll be coming soon though..seen some fabulous paperbarks nearby..a whole street lined with them!
author: Maaret Webb

title: HOW TO BE A BOB ROSS HAPPY LITTLE TREE. 🌲🌲🌲😁😁😁
content:
1. There's no such thing as a mistake
  2. Put happy things into your world.
  3. Everyone has a story
  4. It's ok to be different
  5. Believe in yourself
  6. Do what makes you happy.
  7. Everything gets easier with practice.
  8. Beauty is everywhere
author: Maaret Webb

title: Lazy River
summary: Finally worked out a straightforward way to teach this at my next workshop..Bob painted this one early on in the series..in season 2...and following his process wouldn’t work with students who’ve never painted before.
content:
Finally worked out a straightforward way to teach this at my next workshop..Bob painted this one early on in the series..in season 2...and following his process wouldn’t work with students who’ve never painted before.

E.g. he uses a special paint gun that he’d invented and patented for the thinnest branches on the trees..but it didn’t go into production because it wasn’t cost effective. Interesting bit of trivia, yes? This is my 3rd attempt..tomorrow I’ll paint a final one to use in class.
author: Maaret Webb

title: Introducing Gold Coast Workshops
summary: Introducing Gold Coast Workshops
content:
Starting next month, our Bob Ross workshops will also be held at our studio in Burleigh Heads on the Gold Coast. Continue reading for more details, or head over to arthoughts.com for bookings

These classes will be held on the 3rd Saturday of each month, and will be covering some of Bob’s more simple designs on a smaller canvas, and will run for 3 hours.

Like the workshops in Brisbane, they’re suitable for any skill level, but are the perfect introduction for beginners to Bob’s method. Check out the website
author: Maaret Webb

title: Series 10 Complete
summary: Finished season 10 of the Joy of Painitng with this one..yippee..next big milestone I’m aiming to reach will be season 15…I’ll be halfway then to my final goal…Daily Bobs done and dusted!
author: Maaret Webb

title: A Little Inspiration
summary: First daily Bob of the year…
content:
It was painted yesterday on our home balcony. There are days when I can’t make it to the studio..life happens..so I keep a painting kit at home in one of those big plastic storage containers from a hardware store. It fits nicely into a wardrobe. Being an early riser, I can easily paint at least one on those days.

It was painted yesterday on our home balcony. There are days when I can’t make it to the studio..life happens..so I keep a painting kit at home in one of those big plastic storage containers from a hardware store. It fits nicely into a wardrobe. Being an early riser, I can easily paint at least one on those days.
author: Maaret Webb

title: Series 10 Progress
summary: Season 10…a few more done. Some friends are joining me this year and also painting every painting from Bobs tv series…all 403 of them
content: If anyone else is interested in doing this…here’s my two bob’s worth 😉…I paint small, almost every day, and find a way to accept EVERYTHING. You improve and learn without even noticing, mistakes and failures are part of the deal, just like in life anyway. Twoinchbrush.com is the best source of all you need…all his paintings shown in thumbnails with colour lists and Bobs videos to paint along with. Feel free to pm me if you want more info..if I can’t help, I probably know someone else who can. Happy painting 2020!
author: Maaret Webb

title: The gift of Bob
summary: Know someone that would love the gift of Bob Ross this xmas?
content: Still looking for a Christmas gift for that special someone? 🎁 Our workshops are the perfect Christmas present! Learn how to paint beautiful landscapes from a certified Bob Ross instructor. Each workshop runs for 5 hours, in that time we will help you create your own stunning Bob Ross painting and learn the techniques needed to create more beautiful artwork. 💲 Use the code FACEBOOK to receive 40% off! 💲 Book now at: arthoughts.com
author: Maaret Webb

title: Series 10 Begins
summary: Started series 10…double digits…a happy little milestone!
content: However…having a major blah time today that even Bob couldn’t talk me out of…my painting was looking rather blah too, so of all the things that I could choose from, to turn my blah into a happy accident, I add a cabin…and I hate Bobs cabins!!!! Go figure hey? This is just so out of character that it’s tickling my funny bone and I’m feeling rather cheerful after all..I do like it when life grins and winks at me. The painting’s no better but I feel great 😂
author: Maaret Webb

title: A Little Inspiration
summary: I usually post only about Bob on this page but this fb post by Ryan Stephens is so spot on…a bit of gold to share with my students and it’s what Bob was about anyway…forget perfection and keep painting, and remember the most important thing is that it makes you feel happy! ALLOW YOURSELF TO BE HAPPY. ❤️
author: Maaret Webb

title: Imagination
summary: Imagination is one of the most important things you can possess. So develop your imagination…
content: It’s like any other muscle in the body..use it, exercise it, practise with it. You’ll be amazed at what you can imagine. Pretty soon, if you paint, you become very aware of nature, you become aware of colour and you’re riding down the street and you see a beautiful tree and you say, Oh look at the sap green or the white in the cloud that’s made with a fan brush. You have to be careful though…you get so interested in all the beautiful things that nature has…you drive right off the road!” Bob Ross quote from series 9 episode 13
author: Maaret Webb

title: Another Great Workshop
summary: say “Happy Trees!”…
content: A lot of fun and happiness and hilarity today…happens when you put a fantastic bunch of women together…these ladies rocked it with their paintings..knew what they wanted and did their own versions of Bob’s very first seascape from series 1…so much fun. 💲 Use the code FACEBOOK to receive 40% off! 💲 Book now at: arthoughts.com
author: Maaret Webb

title: Another Great Day Teaching
summary: Another great day teaching…lovely results from all and lots of happy vibes. Class photo outside this time..Bob’s there in the background somewhere 😊
author: Maaret Webb

title: Check the results of this week's workshop
summary: Peep this preview for Next Week's Workshop
content: Will be teaching this at my next class. A quiet painting..Bob’s first seascape in the series from season 1… The paint application for this one is nice and straightforward, but for a happy result, this painting asks for thoughtfulness about placement of the different elements that make up the composition…I found myself quieting down as I painted it..almost a meditation, a centering. Love this one. 💜
author: Maaret Webb

title: Check the results of this week's workshop
summary: Check the results of this week's workshop
content:
So thrilled with the results of today’s class. Am very grateful and in a bit of awe over how the technique delivers. Attitude helps and these gorgeous ladies have the best! Feeling on top of the world thanks to them 💜

If you want to learn to paint from a certified Bob Ross instructor as well, make sure to sign up! We hold workshops on the first three Saturdays of each month at our Studio in Brisbane.

Find our website here: Arthoughts
author: Maaret Webb

title: The Joy of Painting - Seascapes
summary: Working through season 9…used Bob’s newly arrived liquid clear today…very tricky, can’t picture students managing even the very thinnest coat. I’ve used a substitute medium when I ran out of Bob’s product and found that it works brilliantly, much better than Bob’s. Still have plenty of time before I teach a seascape..thank goodness..I’ll be churning them out before then…picture a seascape factory! That’s me. 💜
content:
Seascapes from series 1-9...going to focus on them for a while…feeling the need for it…to connect with their particular kind of mystery and beauty.

The heart of man is very much like the sea.

It has its storms,

it has its tides

and in its depths

it has its pearls too.”

Vincent Van Gogh
author: Maaret Webb

title: I Painted all of Bob Ross Season 8
summary: Finished season 8 finally. Continue reading below to see the results
content:
Finished season 8 finally. Continue reading below to see the results

it’s taken me the longest so far, life has other plans sometimes that don’t involve painting…you can’t see me but you can hear me prattling on about them 😂 Check out the video below…
author: Maaret Webb

title: Scenes for Beginners
summary: These mountain themes are great for newbies to the method…they cover a nice range of techniques with Bob’s magic brushes…all you need to know to get painting along with him at home. 👍😊
author: Maaret Webb

title: Season 8 Progress
summary: Series 8 so far. Discovered my next challenge - the colours in Bob’s foliage…
content: Bob makes use of a wide range of colour as he taps in highlights over an initial dark base for bushes and trees. BOB…”And how about, how about we take some sap green and add a bit of cad yellow to it…and shoot let’s add some indian yellow and yellow ochre and maybe, maybe even a bit of bright red on the same ole dirty brush and the highlights’ll just sparkle out onto those bushes in all kinds of beautiful colours.” ME…looks at muddy brown brush…😩
author: Maaret Webb

title: Two Inch Brush
summary: Thought I’d share this wonderful link which I use all the time.
content: Two Inch Brush is a database listing all Bob Ross paintings from his tv series and has lots of other helpful info…eg a one hour tutorial. A really great feature is a small thumbnail of every painting…you click on it and it brings up the tv episode you want to watch and maybe paint along with or just listen to if you’re feeling stressed…there’s something very soothing about his voice.
author: Maaret Webb

title: Learn to Paint with Us
summary: Here’s one of the paintings taught in our Brisbane studio…anyone can do it! That’s what Bob promised.
content:
This particular painting is from The Joy of Painting, series 5 episode 1 - Mountain Waterfall.

Head over to the website , preview all the painting from upcoming workshops and book online.
author: Maaret Webb

title: Welcome to Arthoughts
summary: Follow us for updates from our Bob Ross painting workshops in Brisbane and on the Gold Coast
content: Welcome to the new Arthoughts blog. Here we’ll keep you posted with abouts to our Bob Ross painting workshops, general painting info and photos of my progress recreating every single landscape painting from the Bob Ross PBS show ‘The Joy of Painting’.
author: Maaret Webb
